sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributable (Recommended)

sections.heading: Solution 2: Verify Game Files

sections.heading: Solution 4: Check Windows Updates

**Step 4**: Restart and try Black Myth Wukong again

**Note**: Black Myth Wukong requires Windows 10 version 1909 or later (Windows 11 recommended).

guides.title: Fix kernel32.dll Error - Windows 11 startup
guides.metaTitle: Fix kernel32.dll Error During Windows 11 startup in Windows
guides.metaDescription: How to fix kernel32.dll errors causing System fails to boot properly. Complete Windows repair guide.
guides.excerpt: Experiencing System fails to boot properly related to kernel32.dll? Here's how to fix it.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the kernel32.dll Error
sections.content:
The **kernel32.dll** is a critical Windows boot component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- System fails to boot properly
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing kernel32.dll
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.

guides.title: Fix mss32.dll Missing Error in Age of Mythology
guides.metaTitle: Fix mss32.dll Missing in Age of Mythology (2002) - Complete Guide
guides.metaDescription: How to fix "mss32.dll is missing" error when playing Age of Mythology. Step-by-step solution for this classic RTS game.
guides.excerpt: Getting "mss32.dll is missing" error in Age of Mythology? This guide shows you exactly how to fix it and get your favorite 2002 classic running again.
guides.author: System Admin Team
keywords: fix Age of Mythology dll error

sections.heading: Why Age of Mythology Shows "mss32.dll is Missing" Error
sections.content:
When you try to launch **Age of Mythology** (2002), you may see an error message stating "mss32.dll is missing" or "The program can't start because mss32.dll was not found".

This error occurs because:

**1. Missing Legacy Runtime**: Age of Mythology was released in 2002 and requires older runtime libraries that aren't included in modern Windows.

**2. Miles Sound System audio engine used by hundreds of games**: The mss32.dll file is essential for Age of Mythology to function properly.

**3. Windows Compatibility**: Modern Windows 10/11 doesn't include some legacy components that 2002-era games need.

**4. Incomplete Installation**: The game's original installer may not have properly installed all required dependencies.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Miles Sound System
sections.content:
The most reliable fix is to install the required runtime:

**Step 1**: Download the official runtime from:
[Miles Sound System](http://www.radgametools.com/mssdist.htm)

**Step 2**: Run the installer and follow the prompts.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

**Step 4**: Try launching Age of Mythology again.

**Note**: For games from 2002, you may also need to install legacy DirectX components.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Install DirectX End-User Runtime
sections.content:
Many classic games from 2002 require legacy DirectX components.

**Step 1**: Download [DirectX End-User Runtime](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)

**Step 2**: Extract and run DXSETUP.exe

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

This installs DirectX 9.0c components alongside modern DirectX 12, which many 2002-era games need.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Run in Windows Compatibility Mode
sections.content:
Since Age of Mythology is from 2002, running it in compatibility mode often helps:

**Step 1**: Right-click the game executable

**Step 2**: Select Properties → Compatibility tab

**Step 3**: Check "Run this program in compatibility mode for:"

**Step 4**: Select "Windows XP (Service Pack 3)" or "Windows 7"

**Step 5**: Also check "Run as administrator"

**Step 6**: Click Apply and OK

sections.heading: Solution 4: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
If you're using Steam, GOG, or other platforms:

**Steam**:
1. Right-click Age of Mythology → Properties
2. Go to Local Files tab
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**GOG Galaxy**:
1. Click the game → Settings (gear icon)
2. Select "Verify / Repair"

**Manual Installation**:
Consider reinstalling the game from the original media or re-downloading.

sections.heading: Still Having Issues?
sections.content:
If the error persists:

1. **Install All Visual C++ Runtimes**: Download and install ALL versions from 2005 to 2022

2. **Check Antivirus**: Temporarily disable antivirus and try again

3. **Run as Administrator**: Always run the game as admin

4. **Virtual Machine**: For very old games, consider running them in a Windows XP virtual machine

5. **Community Patches**: Search for "Age of Mythology modern Windows patch" for community fixes

guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the ntoskrnl.exe Error
sections.content:
The **ntoskrnl.exe** is a critical Windows crash component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- Blue screen of death
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing ntoskrnl.exe
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.

guides.excerpt: Getting "binkw32.dll is missing" error in Neverwinter Nights? This guide shows you exactly how to fix it and get your favorite 2002 classic running again.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Why Neverwinter Nights Shows "binkw32.dll is Missing" Error
sections.content:
When you try to launch **Neverwinter Nights** (2002), you may see an error message stating "binkw32.dll is missing" or "The program can't start because binkw32.dll was not found".

This error occurs because:

**1. Missing Legacy Runtime**: Neverwinter Nights was released in 2002 and requires older runtime libraries that aren't included in modern Windows.

**2. Bink Video codec used by games 1999-2015 for cutscenes**: The binkw32.dll file is essential for Neverwinter Nights to function properly.

**3. Windows Compatibility**: Modern Windows 10/11 doesn't include some legacy components that 2002-era games need.

**4. Incomplete Installation**: The game's original installer may not have properly installed all required dependencies.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install RAD Game Tools Bink Video
sections.content:
The most reliable fix is to install the required runtime:

**Step 1**: Download the official runtime from:
[RAD Game Tools Bink Video](http://www.radgametools.com/bnkdown.htm)

**Step 2**: Run the installer and follow the prompts.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

**Step 4**: Try launching Neverwinter Nights again.

**Note**: For games from 2002, you may also need to install legacy DirectX components.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Install DirectX End-User Runtime
sections.content:
Many classic games from 2002 require legacy DirectX components.

**Step 1**: Download [DirectX End-User Runtime](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)

**Step 2**: Extract and run DXSETUP.exe

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

This installs DirectX 9.0c components alongside modern DirectX 12, which many 2002-era games need.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Run in Windows Compatibility Mode
sections.content:
Since Neverwinter Nights is from 2002, running it in compatibility mode often helps:

**Step 1**: Right-click the game executable

**Step 2**: Select Properties → Compatibility tab

**Step 3**: Check "Run this program in compatibility mode for:"

**Step 4**: Select "Windows XP (Service Pack 3)" or "Windows 7"

**Step 5**: Also check "Run as administrator"

**Step 6**: Click Apply and OK

sections.heading: Solution 4: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
If you're using Steam, GOG, or other platforms:

**Steam**:
1. Right-click Neverwinter Nights → Properties
2. Go to Local Files tab
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**GOG Galaxy**:
1. Click the game → Settings (gear icon)
2. Select "Verify / Repair"

**Manual Installation**:
Consider reinstalling the game from the original media or re-downloading.

sections.heading: Still Having Issues?
sections.content:
If the error persists:

1. **Install All Visual C++ Runtimes**: Download and install ALL versions from 2005 to 2022

2. **Check Antivirus**: Temporarily disable antivirus and try again

3. **Run as Administrator**: Always run the game as admin

4. **Virtual Machine**: For very old games, consider running them in a Windows XP virtual machine

5. **Community Patches**: Search for "Neverwinter Nights modern Windows patch" for community fixes

guides.title: Fix vcruntime140.dll Missing Error in Diablo 4
guides.metaTitle: Fix vcruntime140.dll Missing in Diablo 4 (2023) - Quick Solution
guides.metaDescription: Solve the "vcruntime140.dll is missing" error preventing Diablo 4 from launching. Fast and easy fix guide.
guides.excerpt: Can't play Diablo 4 due to "vcruntime140.dll is missing" error? Here's the quick fix to get you back in the game.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Why Diablo 4 Shows "vcruntime140.dll is Missing"
sections.content:
Diablo 4 (2023) requires the **vcruntime140.dll** runtime library to function. This error appears when:

**1. Missing Visual C++ Runtime**: The required Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable is not installed.

**2. Corrupted Installation**: Game files or runtime libraries have become corrupted.

**3. Incomplete Download**: The game or runtime didn't download completely.

**4. Antivirus Interference**: Security software may have quarantined the DLL file.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributable (Recommended)
sections.content:
This fixes 90% of modern game DLL errors:

**Step 1**: Download both versions:
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x64](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x86](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x86.exe)

**Step 2**: Install BOTH versions (even on 64-bit Windows)

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Launch Diablo 4 again

sections.heading: Solution 2: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
**For Steam**:
1. Right-click Diablo 4 → Properties
2. Local Files → Verify integrity of game files
3. Wait for verification (may take 10-30 minutes)
4. Restart Steam and try again

**For Xbox/Game Pass**:
1. Open Xbox app → Diablo 4
2. Click ⋯ → Manage → Files
3. Click "Verify and repair"

**For Epic Games**:
1. Library → Diablo 4 → ⋯
2. Click Verify

sections.heading: Solution 3: Update Graphics Drivers
sections.content:
Diablo 4 requires up-to-date GPU drivers:

**NVIDIA**: Download from [nvidia.com/drivers](https://www.nvidia.com/drivers)

**AMD**: Download from [amd.com/support](https://www.amd.com/support)

**Intel**: Download from [intel.com/download-center](https://www.intel.com/download-center)

Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for a clean installation if you're having persistent issues.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Check Windows Updates
sections.content:
Ensure Windows is fully updated:

**Step 1**: Press Win + I → Windows Update

**Step 2**: Click "Check for updates"

**Step 3**: Install all available updates

**Step 4**: Restart and try Diablo 4 again

**Note**: Diablo 4 requires Windows 10 version 1909 or later (Windows 11 recommended).

guides.title: Fix mso.dll Missing Error in Microsoft Excel
guides.metaTitle: Fix mso.dll Error in Microsoft Excel 2024 - Solution Guide
guides.metaDescription: Resolve the "mso.dll is missing" error in Microsoft Excel. Professional software fix guide.
guides.excerpt: Microsoft Excel not starting due to "mso.dll is missing"? Here's how to fix it quickly.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Why Microsoft Excel Shows "mso.dll is Missing"
sections.content:
Microsoft Excel depends on the **mso.dll** library for proper operation. Common causes:

**1. Incomplete Installation**: Microsoft Excel installation didn't complete properly.

**2. Missing Runtime**: Required Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable is not installed.

**3. Corrupted Files**: System or application files have become corrupted.

**4. Permission Issues**: Insufficient permissions to access required system components.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributable
sections.content:
Most Office applications require Visual C++ runtime:

**Step 1**: Download both versions:
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x64](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x86](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x86.exe)

**Step 2**: Install both versions

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Launch Microsoft Excel again

sections.heading: Solution 2: Repair Application Installation
sections.content:
**For Microsoft Excel**:
1. Go to Control Panel → Programs → Programs and Features
2. Find Microsoft Excel
3. Right-click → Change/Repair
4. Follow the repair wizard
5. Restart when complete


**For Microsoft Office**: Use the Quick Repair or Online Repair option

sections.heading: Solution 3: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Repair corrupted Windows system files:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for the scan to complete (10-15 minutes)

**Step 4**: If issues found, run: `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`

**Step 5**: Restart and try Microsoft Excel again

sections.heading: Solution 4: Clean Reinstall
sections.content:
If other solutions don't work:

**Step 1**: Uninstall Microsoft Excel completely

**Step 2**: Use an uninstaller tool to remove leftover files

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Download the latest version of Microsoft Excel

**Step 5**: Install as Administrator

guides.title: Fix usbhub3.dll Error - USB device not recognized
guides.metaTitle: Fix usbhub3.dll Error During USB device not recognized in Windows
guides.metaDescription: How to fix usbhub3.dll errors causing USB devices fail to work. Complete Windows repair guide.
guides.excerpt: Experiencing USB devices fail to work related to usbhub3.dll? Here's how to fix it.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the usbhub3.dll Error
sections.content:
The **usbhub3.dll** is a critical Windows driver component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- USB devices fail to work
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing usbhub3.dll
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.

guides.title: Fix audiosrv.dll Error - Audio not working
guides.metaTitle: Fix audiosrv.dll Error During Audio not working in Windows
guides.metaDescription: How to fix audiosrv.dll errors causing No audio output. Complete Windows repair guide.
guides.excerpt: Experiencing No audio output related to audiosrv.dll? Here's how to fix it.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the audiosrv.dll Error
sections.content:
The **audiosrv.dll** is a critical Windows audio component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- No audio output
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing audiosrv.dll
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.

fix Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) dll error
Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) won't start

sections.heading: Why Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) Shows "binkw32.dll is Missing" Error
sections.content:
When you try to launch **Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3)** (2003), you may see an error message stating "binkw32.dll is missing" or "The program can't start because binkw32.dll was not found".

This error occurs because:

**1. Missing Legacy Runtime**: Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) was released in 2003 and requires older runtime libraries that aren't included in modern Windows.

**2. Bink Video codec used by games 1999-2015 for cutscenes**: The binkw32.dll file is essential for Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) to function properly.

**3. Windows Compatibility**: Modern Windows 10/11 doesn't include some legacy components that 2003-era games need.

**4. Incomplete Installation**: The game's original installer may not have properly installed all required dependencies.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install RAD Game Tools Bink Video
sections.content:
The most reliable fix is to install the required runtime:

**Step 1**: Download the official runtime from:
[RAD Game Tools Bink Video](http://www.radgametools.com/bnkdown.htm)

**Step 2**: Run the installer and follow the prompts.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

**Step 4**: Try launching Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) again.

**Note**: For games from 2003, you may also need to install legacy DirectX components.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Install DirectX End-User Runtime
sections.content:
Many classic games from 2003 require legacy DirectX components.

**Step 1**: Download [DirectX End-User Runtime](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)

**Step 2**: Extract and run DXSETUP.exe

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

This installs DirectX 9.0c components alongside modern DirectX 12, which many 2003-era games need.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Run in Windows Compatibility Mode
sections.content:
Since Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) is from 2003, running it in compatibility mode often helps:

**Step 1**: Right-click the game executable

**Step 2**: Select Properties → Compatibility tab

**Step 3**: Check "Run this program in compatibility mode for:"

**Step 4**: Select "Windows XP (Service Pack 3)" or "Windows 7"

**Step 5**: Also check "Run as administrator"

**Step 6**: Click Apply and OK

sections.heading: Solution 4: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
If you're using Steam, GOG, or other platforms:

**Steam**:
1. Right-click Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) → Properties
2. Go to Local Files tab
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**GOG Galaxy**:
1. Click the game → Settings (gear icon)
2. Select "Verify / Repair"

**Manual Installation**:
Consider reinstalling the game from the original media or re-downloading.

sections.heading: Still Having Issues?
sections.content:
If the error persists:

1. **Install All Visual C++ Runtimes**: Download and install ALL versions from 2005 to 2022

2. **Check Antivirus**: Temporarily disable antivirus and try again

3. **Run as Administrator**: Always run the game as admin

4. **Virtual Machine**: For very old games, consider running them in a Windows XP virtual machine

5. **Community Patches**: Search for "Chinese Paladin 3 (仙剑奇侠传3) modern Windows patch" for community fixes

guides.title: Fix vcruntime140.dll Missing Error in Remnant 2
guides.metaTitle: Fix vcruntime140.dll Missing in Remnant 2 (2023) - Quick Solution
guides.metaDescription: Solve the "vcruntime140.dll is missing" error preventing Remnant 2 from launching. Fast and easy fix guide.
guides.excerpt: Can't play Remnant 2 due to "vcruntime140.dll is missing" error? Here's the quick fix to get you back in the game.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Why Remnant 2 Shows "vcruntime140.dll is Missing"
sections.content:
Remnant 2 (2023) requires the **vcruntime140.dll** runtime library to function. This error appears when:

**1. Missing Visual C++ Runtime**: The required Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable is not installed.

**2. Corrupted Installation**: Game files or runtime libraries have become corrupted.

**3. Incomplete Download**: The game or runtime didn't download completely.

**4. Antivirus Interference**: Security software may have quarantined the DLL file.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributable (Recommended)
sections.content:
This fixes 90% of modern game DLL errors:

**Step 1**: Download both versions:
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x64](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x86](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x86.exe)

**Step 2**: Install BOTH versions (even on 64-bit Windows)

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Launch Remnant 2 again

sections.heading: Solution 2: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
**For Steam**:
1. Right-click Remnant 2 → Properties
2. Local Files → Verify integrity of game files
3. Wait for verification (may take 10-30 minutes)
4. Restart Steam and try again

**For Xbox/Game Pass**:
1. Open Xbox app → Remnant 2
2. Click ⋯ → Manage → Files
3. Click "Verify and repair"

**For Epic Games**:
1. Library → Remnant 2 → ⋯
2. Click Verify

sections.heading: Solution 3: Update Graphics Drivers
sections.content:
Remnant 2 requires up-to-date GPU drivers:

**NVIDIA**: Download from [nvidia.com/drivers](https://www.nvidia.com/drivers)

**AMD**: Download from [amd.com/support](https://www.amd.com/support)

**Intel**: Download from [intel.com/download-center](https://www.intel.com/download-center)

Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for a clean installation if you're having persistent issues.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Check Windows Updates
sections.content:
Ensure Windows is fully updated:

**Step 1**: Press Win + I → Windows Update

**Step 2**: Click "Check for updates"

**Step 3**: Install all available updates

**Step 4**: Restart and try Remnant 2 again

**Note**: Remnant 2 requires Windows 10 version 1909 or later (Windows 11 recommended).

4. Follow the repair wizard
5. Restart when complete

sections.heading: Solution 3: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Repair corrupted Windows system files:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for the scan to complete (10-15 minutes)

**Step 4**: If issues found, run: `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`

**Step 5**: Restart and try Visual Studio again

sections.heading: Solution 4: Clean Reinstall
sections.content:
If other solutions don't work:

**Step 1**: Uninstall Visual Studio completely

**Step 2**: Use an uninstaller tool to remove leftover files

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Download the latest version of Visual Studio

**Step 5**: Install as Administrator

guides.title: Fix taskmgr.exe Error - Task Manager crash
guides.metaTitle: Fix taskmgr.exe Error During Task Manager crash in Windows
guides.metaDescription: How to fix taskmgr.exe errors causing Task Manager fails to open. Complete Windows repair guide.
guides.excerpt: Experiencing Task Manager fails to open related to taskmgr.exe? Here's how to fix it.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the taskmgr.exe Error
sections.content:
The **taskmgr.exe** is a critical Windows system component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- Task Manager fails to open
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing taskmgr.exe
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.

guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the searchindexer.exe Error
sections.content:
The **searchindexer.exe** is a critical Windows search component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- Windows Search fails
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing searchindexer.exe
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.

guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the wsservice.dll Error
sections.content:
The **wsservice.dll** is a critical Windows store component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- Microsoft Store fails to open
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing wsservice.dll
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.

guides.title: Fix mss32.dll Missing Error in Call of Duty 2
guides.metaTitle: Fix mss32.dll Missing in Call of Duty 2 (2005) - Complete Guide
guides.metaDescription: How to fix "mss32.dll is missing" error when playing Call of Duty 2. Step-by-step solution for this classic FPS game.
guides.excerpt: Getting "mss32.dll is missing" error in Call of Duty 2? This guide shows you exactly how to fix it and get your favorite 2005 classic running again.
guides.author: System Admin Team
keywords: fix Call of Duty 2 dll error

sections.heading: Why Call of Duty 2 Shows "mss32.dll is Missing" Error
sections.content:
When you try to launch **Call of Duty 2** (2005), you may see an error message stating "mss32.dll is missing" or "The program can't start because mss32.dll was not found".

This error occurs because:

**1. Missing Legacy Runtime**: Call of Duty 2 was released in 2005 and requires older runtime libraries that aren't included in modern Windows.

**2. Miles Sound System audio engine used by hundreds of games**: The mss32.dll file is essential for Call of Duty 2 to function properly.

**3. Windows Compatibility**: Modern Windows 10/11 doesn't include some legacy components that 2005-era games need.

**4. Incomplete Installation**: The game's original installer may not have properly installed all required dependencies.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Miles Sound System
sections.content:
The most reliable fix is to install the required runtime:

**Step 1**: Download the official runtime from:
[Miles Sound System](http://www.radgametools.com/mssdist.htm)

**Step 2**: Run the installer and follow the prompts.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

**Step 4**: Try launching Call of Duty 2 again.

**Note**: For games from 2005, you may also need to install legacy DirectX components.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Install DirectX End-User Runtime
sections.content:
Many classic games from 2005 require legacy DirectX components.

**Step 1**: Download [DirectX End-User Runtime](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)

**Step 2**: Extract and run DXSETUP.exe

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

This installs DirectX 9.0c components alongside modern DirectX 12, which many 2005-era games need.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Run in Windows Compatibility Mode
sections.content:
Since Call of Duty 2 is from 2005, running it in compatibility mode often helps:

**Step 1**: Right-click the game executable

**Step 2**: Select Properties → Compatibility tab

**Step 3**: Check "Run this program in compatibility mode for:"

**Step 4**: Select "Windows XP (Service Pack 3)" or "Windows 7"

**Step 5**: Also check "Run as administrator"

**Step 6**: Click Apply and OK

sections.heading: Solution 4: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
If you're using Steam, GOG, or other platforms:

**Steam**:
1. Right-click Call of Duty 2 → Properties
2. Go to Local Files tab
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**GOG Galaxy**:
1. Click the game → Settings (gear icon)
2. Select "Verify / Repair"

**Manual Installation**:
Consider reinstalling the game from the original media or re-downloading.

sections.heading: Still Having Issues?
sections.content:
If the error persists:

1. **Install All Visual C++ Runtimes**: Download and install ALL versions from 2005 to 2022

2. **Check Antivirus**: Temporarily disable antivirus and try again

3. **Run as Administrator**: Always run the game as admin

4. **Virtual Machine**: For very old games, consider running them in a Windows XP virtual machine

5. **Community Patches**: Search for "Call of Duty 2 modern Windows patch" for community fixes

**Step 5**: Also check "Run as administrator"

**Step 6**: Click Apply and OK

sections.heading: Solution 4: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
If you're using Steam, GOG, or other platforms:

**Steam**:
1. Right-click Half Life 2 → Properties
2. Go to Local Files tab
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**GOG Galaxy**:
1. Click the game → Settings (gear icon)
2. Select "Verify / Repair"

**Manual Installation**:
Consider reinstalling the game from the original media or re-downloading.

sections.heading: Still Having Issues?
sections.content:
If the error persists:

1. **Install All Visual C++ Runtimes**: Download and install ALL versions from 2005 to 2022

2. **Check Antivirus**: Temporarily disable antivirus and try again

3. **Run as Administrator**: Always run the game as admin

4. **Virtual Machine**: For very old games, consider running them in a Windows XP virtual machine

5. **Community Patches**: Search for "Half Life 2 modern Windows patch" for community fixes

guides.title: Fix vcruntime140.dll Missing Error in Monster Hunter Rise
guides.metaTitle: Fix vcruntime140.dll Missing in Monster Hunter Rise (2022) - Quick Solution
guides.metaDescription: Solve the "vcruntime140.dll is missing" error preventing Monster Hunter Rise from launching. Fast and easy fix guide.
guides.excerpt: Can't play Monster Hunter Rise due to "vcruntime140.dll is missing" error? Here's the quick fix to get you back in the game.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Why Monster Hunter Rise Shows "vcruntime140.dll is Missing"
sections.content:
Monster Hunter Rise (2022) requires the **vcruntime140.dll** runtime library to function. This error appears when:

**1. Missing Visual C++ Runtime**: The required Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable is not installed.

**2. Corrupted Installation**: Game files or runtime libraries have become corrupted.

**3. Incomplete Download**: The game or runtime didn't download completely.

**4. Antivirus Interference**: Security software may have quarantined the DLL file.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributable (Recommended)
sections.content:
This fixes 90% of modern game DLL errors:

**Step 1**: Download both versions:
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x64](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x86](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x86.exe)

**Step 2**: Install BOTH versions (even on 64-bit Windows)

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Launch Monster Hunter Rise again

sections.heading: Solution 2: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
**For Steam**:
1. Right-click Monster Hunter Rise → Properties
2. Local Files → Verify integrity of game files
3. Wait for verification (may take 10-30 minutes)
4. Restart Steam and try again

**For Xbox/Game Pass**:
1. Open Xbox app → Monster Hunter Rise
2. Click ⋯ → Manage → Files
3. Click "Verify and repair"

**For Epic Games**:
1. Library → Monster Hunter Rise → ⋯
2. Click Verify

sections.heading: Solution 3: Update Graphics Drivers
sections.content:
Monster Hunter Rise requires up-to-date GPU drivers:

**NVIDIA**: Download from [nvidia.com/drivers](https://www.nvidia.com/drivers)

**AMD**: Download from [amd.com/support](https://www.amd.com/support)

**Intel**: Download from [intel.com/download-center](https://www.intel.com/download-center)

Use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) for a clean installation if you're having persistent issues.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Check Windows Updates
sections.content:
Ensure Windows is fully updated:

**Step 1**: Press Win + I → Windows Update

**Step 2**: Click "Check for updates"

**Step 3**: Install all available updates

**Step 4**: Restart and try Monster Hunter Rise again

guides.title: Fix vcruntime140.dll Missing Error in Unity
guides.metaTitle: Fix vcruntime140.dll Error in Unity 2024 - Solution Guide
guides.metaDescription: Resolve the "vcruntime140.dll is missing" error in Unity. Professional software fix guide.
guides.excerpt: Unity not starting due to "vcruntime140.dll is missing"? Here's how to fix it quickly.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Why Unity Shows "vcruntime140.dll is Missing"
sections.content:
Unity depends on the **vcruntime140.dll** library for proper operation. Common causes:

**1. Incomplete Installation**: Unity installation didn't complete properly.

**2. Missing Runtime**: Required Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable is not installed.

**3. Corrupted Files**: System or application files have become corrupted.

**4. Permission Issues**: Insufficient permissions to access required system components.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributable
sections.content:
Most Game Engine applications require Visual C++ runtime:

**Step 1**: Download both versions:
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x64](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x86](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x86.exe)

**Step 2**: Install both versions

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Launch Unity again

sections.heading: Solution 2: Repair Application Installation
sections.content:
**For Unity**:
1. Go to Control Panel → Programs → Programs and Features
2. Find Unity
3. Right-click → Change/Repair
4. Follow the repair wizard
5. Restart when complete

sections.heading: Solution 3: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Repair corrupted Windows system files:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for the scan to complete (10-15 minutes)

**Step 4**: If issues found, run: `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`

**Step 5**: Restart and try Unity again

sections.heading: Solution 4: Clean Reinstall
sections.content:
If other solutions don't work:

**Step 1**: Uninstall Unity completely

**Step 2**: Use an uninstaller tool to remove leftover files

**Step 3**: Restart your computer

**Step 4**: Download the latest version of Unity

**Step 5**: Install as Administrator

guides.title: Fix mpengine.dll Error - Windows Defender error
guides.metaTitle: Fix mpengine.dll Error During Windows Defender error in Windows
guides.metaDescription: How to fix mpengine.dll errors causing Windows Defender fails to start. Complete Windows repair guide.
guides.excerpt: Experiencing Windows Defender fails to start related to mpengine.dll? Here's how to fix it.
guides.author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Understanding the mpengine.dll Error
sections.content:
The **mpengine.dll** is a critical Windows security component. When it fails:

**Symptoms**:
- Windows Defender fails to start
- System instability or crashes
- Error messages referencing mpengine.dll
- Blue screen errors (in severe cases)

**Common Causes**:
1. Corrupted Windows system files
2. Failed Windows Update
3. Malware infection
4. Hardware issues
5. Driver conflicts

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted system files:

**Step 1**: Press Win + X → Terminal (Admin) or Command Prompt (Admin)

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for completion (15-30 minutes)

**Step 4**: Restart your computer

If issues are found but can't be fixed, continue to the next solution.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run DISM Repair
sections.content:
DISM can repair the Windows image when SFC fails:

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator

**Step 2**: Run these commands in order:

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**Step 3**: This may take 20-30 minutes

**Step 4**: Restart and run `sfc /scannow` again

sections.heading: Solution 3: Startup Repair
sections.content:
Use Windows Recovery Environment:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Restart now" under Advanced startup

**Step 3**: Choose: Troubleshoot → Advanced options → Startup Repair

**Step 4**: Let Windows attempt automatic repairs

**Alternative**: Boot from Windows installation media and select "Repair your computer"

sections.heading: Solution 4: System Restore
sections.content:
Restore to a point before the error started:

**Step 1**: Search for "Create a restore point" in Start menu

**Step 2**: Click "System Restore"

**Step 3**: Select a restore point from before the issue began

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard and restart

**Note**: This doesn't affect personal files, only system settings and programs.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Windows Reset (Last Resort)
sections.content:
If nothing else works:

**Step 1**: Go to Settings → System → Recovery

**Step 2**: Click "Reset this PC"

**Step 3**: Choose "Keep my files" to preserve personal data

**Step 4**: Follow the wizard to reinstall Windows

This reinstalls Windows while optionally keeping your files, but removes all installed applications.
